intro: Muscari neglectum subsp. odorum, commonly known as the fragrant muscar, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces a distinctive, sweet fragrance, which is more pronounced in certain cultivars. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
